Why does this `find` command keep all files older than 6 days in the `$DEST_FOLDER` directory?

Actually, this `find` command does the opposite: it removes files older than 6 days in the `$DEST_FOLDER` directory. The `-mtime +6` option specifies files with a modification time older than 6 days, and the `-exec rm {}` part removes them.

# Keep only last 6 days - BE SURE to fully understand how it works, as every "rm" command!
find $DEST_FOLDER/wallet* -type f -mtime +6 -exec rm {} ;
```

(submitted by @TexWiller)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
Does this `find` command only remove files with the exact name "wallet" in the `$DEST_FOLDER` directory?
No, the command removes files with names starting with "wallet", not just the exact name "wallet". The `wallet*` pattern is a glob that matches any file name that starts with "wallet".

# Keep only last 6 days - BE SURE to fully understand how it works, as every "rm" command!
find $DEST_FOLDER/wallet* -type f -mtime +6 -exec rm {} ;
```

(submitted by @TexWiller)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
